The scene position modes allow you to select SR Auto (scene recognition helps me frame the scene & automatically chooses the ideal settings), Auto (for ordinary snapshots),  Advanced mode (lots of flexibility with this one), Custom (accepts user preferences), Aperture priority (sets the aperture), Shutter priority (sets the shutter speed), Scene positions (helps me match the scene with the settings I have chossen), Program AE (allows me to use settings other than the aperture & shutter priorities), and motion panorama (allows me to sweep the camera right or lift for panoramic pictures). I have just started using some of these settings & I like what I see.When I know the kinds of pictures I would like to take, the s8200 gives me position settings that help get the best picture. I can use Portrait, Landscape, Night, Night (Tripod), Snow, Flower, Baby, Smart, Fireworks, Beach, Text, Smile & Shoot, Sunset & Party. As I said earlier, the camera is smarter than I am right now, but I'm learning and I'm not feeling stressed about these features.The Fufjifilm s8200 also has video capabilities, but I'm not into them ... yet. As I said, I can learn as I go without feeling threatened by my camera.One of the best reasons to buy a  Fujifilm s8200? Other cameras with the same or similar features are more than double or triple the cost of the s8200.The s8200 takes easy-to-find AA batteries. Although I bought extra specialized rechargeable batteries for my older digitals, I still found myself running out of power at the most inopertune moments. I can deal with a battery emergency with less stress because AA batteries are everywhere.OK, so what don't I like? Well, It is heavier than the point-and-shoot digitals I've been using, but it is surprisingly light when I compare it with my previous 35 mm experience. I know that is a HUGE variation, but the s8200's weight is not an issue for me. Sure, it's bigger, thicker, wider, etc, but I feel like I am using a real camera. OK, so I can't carry it in my pocket ... or my purse. Well, I guess I could get a bigger purse (just kidding!). When I bought the camera, I also bought a delightful little camera bag that is just the right size for the camera & a few accessories.If you like to switch lenses, the s8200 is not for you. It has a fixed lens with enough flexibility to meet my needs. I do not need to have specialized extra lenses to worry about. I am gladly giving up the extra lenses for my 8200's scene position settings.Overall, I am happy. My nieces & nephews do interesting things & now I can take better pictures of them doing so.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tanya Hughes
Reviews.Content: This camera is really nice. I love the panorama option and it's really easy to use. Product was new as promised in original packaging. Photos are gorgeous. Went from a Cannon 4x zoom to this and what a difference. Took a great picture of a plane in the sky!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: JAL
Reviews.Content: I have another FujiFilm camera.I decided to buy this one and upgrade the one I have.They are very easy to use and take great photos.

Reviews.Title: I wanted to like it.....
Reviews.Author: Kami R. Beck
Reviews.Content: I received the Fujifilm S8200 as a Christmas gift. I had originally purchased the Nikon L820 but decided that the Fuji was better with full manual controls, a 40x zoom, an EVF, and many filters and effects. However, when I took pictures with it outdoors, there was a lot of noise in the pictures. For some reason, the auto mode set the ISO really high, so I lowered it, but the noise was still there. I then went to the Nikon L820 and the Fuji S8200 Flickr pools and looked at sample images, and the Nikon's were much better, crisp and clear, but the Fujifilm's were noisy and of low quality. The EVF is of low quality and you can't see details with it, even with adjustments. The autofocus has focusing issues at any distance. Don't buy this camera without looking at sample images.

Reviews.Title: This is the one!
Reviews.Author: Patricia Cotton
Reviews.Content: This camera was recommended by a friend who is a photographer and also has purchased the same camera. I explained to him the features I wanted in a camera and how I was so disappointed with the current moderately priced cameras which I had been able to find. He then explained the features of this camera and recommended I buy this one. This camera has many features not found in other cameras in the same price range. It does a very nice job on automatic for the person who does not want to learn all the particulars of photography, but has settings for artistic control for the amateur or professional photographer. I am very pleased with this purchase and especially appreciate the available view finder for shots in the bright sun light. The fact that it also uses 4 batteries size AA helps the flash to recover more quickly and insures longer battery life. Unless you are willing to pay a lot more money for a professional quality camera, This is the one!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Dexter
Reviews.Content: I like it. Haven't used it much but have noticed that it takes pics very fast compared to the other digital cameras i've had. No lag...n takes very good pics.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm S8400W Camera
Reviews.Author: Ken Ledeman
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on time, performed as expected and indicated in your information.  I plan to enjoy this camera for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: AA powered camera
Reviews.Author: Chad Hughes
Reviews.Content: bought as a gift, this camera was purchased because of it's AA battery power.  Requires 4 batteries, the gift was for a person who was unable to remember to keep their other point and shoot charged.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: GREGORY E HOLTZ
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the average user.  Still learning how to best use it.  I really like the zoom lens, but mot important featureI wanted was a viewfinder as I often take action pictures in bright light.  The 3" LCD display is nice for reviewing your photos

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price....
Reviews.Author: Julie Soto
Reviews.Content: I purchase this camera so I wouldn't have to use my phone to take pictures of my children. I love the ease of use of the camera phone, but sometimes the pictures aren't are high of quality as I would like. I have only had this camera for a short period, but recenlty used it at the zoo and the zoom and details of some of the animals came out amazingly. I love the continuous picture option, especially when my kids are running around or moving, as I have a 2-year old and a 8-month old.The black and white option on the camer is great. The pictures come out so clear everyone I have shown the camera to has loved it. In fact, I am buying one for my brother-in-law for his birthday.

Reviews.Title: Great Value. Great camera.
Reviews.Author: William Cinadr
Reviews.Content: Graduation present for our daughter. She has always been a good photographer. Now she is more of a full-featured one. This camera was recommended by a friend who is a published photographer. He has more high-end cameras but made the recommendation based on specs. She has since signed up for some on-line (free) photography classed.

Reviews.Title: GOOD BYE FOR THE MONEY.
Reviews.Author: akkelley
Reviews.Content: WELL THIS IS A GOOD STARTING CAMERA. I BOUGHT IT FOR MY GRILFRIEND AND SHE LOVE IT. THIS IS A  46 X OPTICAL ZOOM. IT SAID RIGHT ON THE CAMERA LENS. NOT SURE WHY THEY KEEP SAYING IT IS A 42 X .I USE ....PRO TYPE DSLR CAMERAS.... ( SONY A 77 AND A99 ALFA  MODELS.) BUT THEY ARE A LITTLE TO BIG FOR HER. TO HEAVY AND HARD TO USE. BUT THIS CAMERA DOES A MILLION THINGS. GREAT PRICE AT AMAZON . COM.  S MM.OME TIMES I EVEN USE THE CAMREA BECAUSE OF THE BIG ZOOM RANGE. TO PHOTOGRAPH ANIMALS AT LONG RANGE. MY BIGGEST LENS IS A 600.MM LENS. AA BATTERYS HOLD UP PRETTY GOOD. AND YOU CAN GET THEM ANY WHERE. THE PANORAMA, ADV.,  SR AUTO AND SP STTTINGS WORK PRETTY GOOD MOST OF THE TIME. THE  LAYOUT ON THE CAMERA IS VERY WELL DESIGN. NICE COMFORABLE FEEL TO IT. THIS A NOT A ...DSLR CAMERA. BUT YOU GET ALOT FOR THE MONEY AT AMZON.COM..I PAYED JUST OVER 200.00 DOLLARS. I GAVE IT 4 * RATTING BECAUSE IT IS HARD TO FINE A BETTER CAMERA IN THAT PRICE RANGE.  GOOD SHOOTING OUT THERE EVERY ONE.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Albert J. Coy
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It was purchased to replace a Fuji 9000 that was lost.  Lots of great features, easy to use, still uses 4 AA batteries instead of usb or battery pack and takes great photos.  The only downside is that it does not come with a memory card.  Some of the features are you can make movies and take panaramic photos.  Both came in real handy the first time out using it.  Audio is a bit low for the movies in play back on a computer though.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dan White "Dan Whitepath  Flutemaker"
Reviews.Content: I have not used my new camera as much as I would like yet, but so far am very pleased.  I wanted to shoot video of RC planes in flight and am finding this a bit difficult, but it is with Any camera.  The view finder is useful for this however.  I have shot many stills of my new planes and helis and they all turn out great.  A nice little gray rat snake visited my wife's hanging basket of Petunia's and I got a super sharp, great shot of the rascal with his tongue flicking out.  I think this camera is top quality and as feature packed as many much more expensive brands.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Marti
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a digital camera with a view finder & the digital screen I found both in this camera.  I have only used it a couple of times.  The picture image is awesome.  The cons is there is no internal storage.  All the other digital cameras I have owned always had a small amount of digital storage.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Sandra L. Channin
Reviews.Content: This is my second fuji finepix camera. It is a fantastic camera with a view finder  for the money. I have a collection of many beautiful photos taken with fugi finepix.  My only small complaint is that the battery cover is difficult to close.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Nightwing's Fan "starchild212"
Reviews.Content: Camera takes decent photos with zoom. Took some decent shots from a balcony at a concert.  Takes nice photos in HD /widescreen.  Have to really press in record button to film footage.  Color is crisp.  Filming looks great in black and white but the audio does sound a bit tinny--odd thing about it is it don't countdown AND shows time left on memory card to film.  Menu can sometimes be hard to navigate--they don't give you a booklet manual--but one on a cd-rom.  Much life used with Duracell batteries. For the price it is really good for what it does.

Reviews.Title: Excellent bridge to dslr
Reviews.Author: STEPHEN
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, great battery life and the range of the zoom is excellentManual operations give a good opportunity to learn photography skill

Reviews.Title: Love the Zoom!
Reviews.Author: Brad Gray
Reviews.Content: This is my first "real" camera. So I'm no expert, but with this 42x zoom I was able to take some pictures of a mother eagle feeding her baby from over 200 ft. away and It looks like I was right next to them. I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: interesting package
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: so far this  has proven to be a good product, pictures are full of colour ant the zoom is great

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Ray Lockwood
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for birthday and Mother's Day and she loves it.  It is perfect for a person is starting out and wants something more than a point and shoot camera.  It was priced right and has enough features to keep her learning for a while but the ease if she wants to point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: great deal wonderful cameria
Reviews.Author: trapper
Reviews.Content: great deal wonderful camera,so many things you can do,I bought this for my son and he uses it every ware go loves it

Reviews.Title: I love the Fujiflm FinePix S8200
Reviews.Author: John D. Morse
Reviews.Content: I love it. It is everything I expected. I would buy it again. I would recommend the camera and seller. Great value!

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: SHarda
Reviews.Content: Excellent, value for money. I would recommend this for beginners. I'm am still sorting out the the full features but the picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life Awful!
Reviews.Author: gobucks
Reviews.Content: The features of this camera are great... when the batteries aren't drained! After first purchasing, I noticed my rechargeable batteries weren't lasting very long. I assumed it was either the brand or the fact that they were a little older, so I purchased a new set of rechargeables in a different brand. The new set lasted as long as the old set, for maybe a total of 50 pictures before the camera shut down. I don't know if I got a camera with a bad connection in the battery compartment, but I hate having to take two spare sets of batteries just for casual photo shooting. I'm not using any of the fancy features or camera settings, and I've never shot a video with it. It sounds like other people are having better luck with their camera, and I did lots of research before choosing this model, assuming I'd have just as positive of an experience. I've contacted the company for suggestions, and I will add to my review after I (hopefully) hear from them.

Reviews.Title: Great caamera
Reviews.Author: Coxey
Reviews.Content: Has many of the features of more expensive models, without the size, weight, or cost.Easily totable. Great pictures.Great camera.Great price.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Dee Dee Padilla
Reviews.Content: i used to have a Canon - but the batteries always needed to be changed,, this camera works ALOT better and i would recommend this camera for all

Reviews.Title: poor viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera was bigger and heavier than I wanted, but so few cameras for the "lazy" photographer who is not trying for a Pulitzer, just wants a decent vacation pix, have an eye piece anymore.  Apparently many people don't bother to frame a picture before snapping since most screens are not visible in even moderate sun.  The eye piece in this is a TV screen with very poor resolution and I find it frustrating to use.  I also wanted a camera that could take fast flash pix of my active grandkids.  While it does freeze the action well, the flash takes its time about being ready to go.  The stabilizer in the camera seems pretty good, I can manage to take much better telephoto shots with this camera and action shots come out remarkably clear.  Again, I am lazy, no tripod for me.  The various options on the camera are far more complicated than I wanted and I don't have the patience to make learning to use the camera a big priority. It's not intuitive IMO.  Also I find colors are a little off.  I also haven't figured out how to use it in bright sun.  I really hate having to try to re-set all the parameters every time I want to take a picture. It definitely has some features that are better than my old camera, but it certainly isn't the camera of my dreams.

Reviews.Title: Fine Camera
Reviews.Author: Darth Corvus
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from the product description. My wife loves it and prefers it over the similar Canon model this one replaced.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!
Reviews.Author: melissa brown
Reviews.Content: I love the many features this camera offers and the price on Amazon was much better than in the store

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ava H. Coley
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent shopping experience.  I wish all my purchases could be made online with as little hassle as these. Great Shopping Experience.

Reviews.Title: Truly a professional best gift
Reviews.Author: summer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my best friend since her last camera got stolen being a lot more professional and alot more in depth in photography than me I knew she was stuck in the cannon or Nikon age but when I saw the features on this camera with the zoom range of 42 x without an attachment lens and the use of a rechargeble aa battery I knew she would jus fall in love with this and I was right she loved it and even said she never had looked at fijifilm cameras before !

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Dave Martin
Reviews.Content: Okay.. to start with, I am NOT a photographer...  I'm just a point and click kinda guy and for the past 4 years have only used my smartphone for pics.  I have 2 great trips coming up and wanted a nice camera.  Received this yesterday and started playing with it.  I cannot believe the pics it takes on the Auto setting.  I have lots more playing around to do trying out all the settings, but I can tell already that I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: C. scott
Reviews.Content: I have taken some great photos with this camera! There are somethings I wasn't impressed with though. 1) It didn't take very good pictures of stars, or moons. 2) while zooming in and out on a video, you can't hear anything but the lens moving. Other than those things, it is really quite good. I love taking pictures of sunsets and other fun landscapes. If you can't get anything over $200, this is pretty good when you know all of the special effects and such.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Kim Frymire
Reviews.Content: I have a nother Fujifine pix 30X optical that I broke the viewfinder on. The S8200 ended up having better stabilization with a greater optical zoom and the lowlight setting is a big improvement. I primarily use it for shooting in low lighting in concert situations. Happy with my shots so far.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: J. Landry
Reviews.Content: Nothing special. I knew what it was when I bought it. It works as advertized. Overpriced for it's usable life span. I use this simply as an event/data recorder. In other words a throw away; If it's stolen I haven't lost much. This is not for serious photography.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Farmerdan
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best camera I have owned.  I have always had a compact digital camera but it was time to move up to a nicer camera. There are many things going on with my family that requires a very good camera that takes good pictures and movies.This is the one.....  telescopic lens for extremely far off things etc.  I just take out the SD card and pop into my laptop to down load the pictures and movies ....  sending them via email to my family and friends is very easy.Highly recommend this camera...............

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: Carlene Lind-Baker
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera. It is lightweight and easy to use.  I've taken several pictures and found the pictures to be clear and sharp for me.  If you want a digital camera that is easy to use, then I would definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: J. Silvers
Reviews.Content: My wife loves to take pictures and the camera she had was a little old so I got her this she absolutely loves it she said it is great she takes so many pictures of our kids and grandbabies I am glad I got it for her

Reviews.Title: My third Fuji FinePix.
Reviews.Author: Edgar F. Garner "Mt. Man"
Reviews.Content: My third Fuji because it takes great pictures when you are not a pro. I have had some folks say my pictures are pro. The reason I keep buying another is to get the greater zoon in one package. The second best thing is Fuji only requires AA batteries you can find everywhere. My older Fuji's still work great but I keep liking the newer one even more. Can't tell you how many folks go on vacation and have a hard time finding special batteries for their cameras. Want a great camera and a good deal, buy Fuji and get the Fuji case, it is also great.

Reviews.Title: I lve my new camera
Reviews.Author: the deandrea's
Reviews.Content: I brought this as a starter camera and it is very good. it has amazing quality. I took this picture of a hummingbird and it looks so clear and its so detailed you can see each part of it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Howard
Reviews.Content: I had 2 friends recommend Fujifilm camera.  I am very happy with this one.  The only problem I have is that the Basic Manual, that was listed as coming with the camera, was not included.  To me this is an important item that you would carry with your camera.  I have contacted Fujifilm about this but they have not replied.  Still, I would purchase this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Coleman Travis
Reviews.Content: Though I have been told that camera's with view finders are "not the thing of the future" the camera will meet my needs. The fact that I had the opportunity to purchase a protection plan online gave me confidence in the seller.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for amature photographers
Reviews.Author: Citi
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer however, I took an opinion from a friend who knows cameras. He rated it pretty good. I find this camera a real good, still exploring real all its attributes and slowly I am falling in love with it. A good piece of equipment for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Laura Wheeler
Reviews.Content: This camera just fits my hand to a T ... takes beautiful pictures from the wide angle to the longest telephoto with it's impressive lens.  I especially like how I can take portrait shots of my grandkids running and playing without their knowing it.  I have gotten some really good ones ... and I am so pleased at the ease of it.  I really bought this for my upcoming trip in an RV to Alaska this summer ... and a transatlantic cruise and visiting with friends in Spain in April and May.

Reviews.Title: Loaded wit many features, Great zoom lense.
Reviews.Author: Gottfried F. Metzler "Ole Photographer"
Reviews.Content: This is my third FinePix camera. It has may steps up in quality and ease of use.  The night-time exposure feature is wonderful. The panoramic feature is much improved.

Reviews.Title: Nice and easy
Reviews.Author: eveline kanganis
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Easy to use. Happy I made the purchase. Recommend it to someone looking for a great inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantasitic camera for the price
Reviews.Author: rgernst1
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera after doing considerable research on many in this price range.  The features and photo quality are fantastic for this price.  I was suprised that no operating manual was included but it was not a big deal to down load the correct manual.  I am delighted with the unit thus far

Reviews.Title: It came early!!!! YEA!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Link
Reviews.Content: This was the whole reason for a birthday combo gift and it came in one month early!!! Thank you so much. My soon to be 13 year old is very happy with ease of use and the quality of the pictures!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm s8200
Reviews.Author: photo hobbiest
Reviews.Content: I have two Canons, and I love them.  I bought this so I could have a camera with me most of the time.  It is great for what it is.  I doesn't take the quality shots that the Canons do with lenses that cost a few times more than the Fuji.  It pretty much does what I expected it to do, and I like it.  The manual controls are not quite a versatile as I would like, but they give me some flexibility beyond automatic.  The control wheel is a little sensitive and difficult to get it to do what I want it to without bumping into something else, especially with cold fingers.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Jerrel E. Phillips
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a bridge camera when I didn't want to be carrying my DSLR. In the past I've always owned Canon cameras and this time I was again expecting to buy a Canon. However, when features and price were factored in there is simply no way that the Canon bridge cameras will measure up--particularly when they are producing cameras that do not use AA batteries and then have well documented problems with battery life. Nevertheless, I was hesitant to go with the S8200 because of some reviews of poor picture quality. I needn't have been.The picture quality on the S8200 is equally as good as the Canon Poweshot cameras I've owned in the past. The lens is equally as sharp, though a bit slower. As far as features go the S8200 cannot be beat in this price range. I have taken it on outings doing landscape work, birding etc. and it performs as expected.The only drawbacks I've noticed concern low light performance. The camera does have problems focusing in low light situations, but then, I've also found that this can often be corrected by using one of the special settings that are there to handle such situations.While I haven't used the video much at all, when I have used it I have gotten excellent quality images and they have been easily uploaded to Windows Media Player or other such software such as Corel.The bottom line is that this camera performs amazingly well for a bridge camera. It is not a DSLR, so don't expect it to perform as one. However, I highly recommend the S8200 if you are looking for a camera that feels good in your hands, has plenty of features, produces good images and therefore prompts you to take more pictures--which is what a bridge camera should do.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: LB
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my husband for his Birthday gift.  He is very happy with it. It takes great pictures and has a multitude of settings for various shots. The price point was right for my budget too. All said.....great bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: very satisified
Reviews.Author: M. Powell
Reviews.Content: I am a very pleased with this idem. It is everything i expected it to be and more. Great Camera

Reviews.Title: Great Cam
Reviews.Author: JoAndra Van Dowall
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning how to use this camera, both still and video. The only problem I haven't solved yet is how to focus from a distance. I have some vids that are a bit blurry. I'm sure I can figure that out. Overall, I give this item a 99% satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: kenneth mason
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and a viewfinder makes it great for bright conditions. The zoom is amazing and provides sharp pictures. I have a digital SLR that I love but for every day use this camera in much easier to use. I would recommend it for vacation travel and all around photo needs.

Reviews.Title: What A Deal
Reviews.Author: Guy G.
Reviews.Content: I have always liked and used cameras of different capabilities.  A close friend of ours introduced me to this camera and I felt I just had to have one also.  I am not at all unhappy with my purchase.  I am still learning all the wonderful features that this camera has to offer.  I highly recomment this product to anyone who enjoys great pictures and lots of value for their money.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Francisco Izurieta
Reviews.Content: Very good quality and technology, much more than price.I would request to improve the menus but, it's ok for standard.

Reviews.Title: Nice features but lacking in picture quality
Reviews.Author: T Wilson "fitwilsons"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photographer so maybe if I was more knowledgable I could've made this camera work for me, but i'm not and it was sent back.  The features are great!  I wanted to like this camera SO much!!  I did a bunch of research and narrowed it down to this model for my price range/needs.  In the end, my iPhone 5s took better quality pictures so this was returned.The zoom is great.  We live in a woodsy area and have a lot of wildlife to snap pictures of and this could zoom in to capture the best shots.  In fact the outdoor pictures were fine.  When I took indoor portraits of my daughter with this and my iPhone, the iPhone just took a much better picture.  The color was amazing, the shading was just right and it was crystal clear.  With the Fuji, the color was too washed out and harsh, there were more shadows and the picture looked more "grainy" (noise I believe it's called?).I ended up getting a Nikon L820 instead.  I debated because the Nikon lacks some features that I really wanted (a viewfinder for one), but the picture quality is better and that's what I need.  It's also smaller and easier to tote along.

Reviews.Title: Fuji S8200
Reviews.Author: floyd
Reviews.Content: shipping on time, made it in good shape. $185 i think that was a steal, i call it buy'n a last years model. it be'n my first real camera an all i got nothing to compare it to. well im off to play with my new toy. P.S. have to say i is real happy!

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Michael Zamzow
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything, It's automatic modes work perfectly. Customization of settings is relatively easy to figure out. One wish: remote capability. Realized this after the need arose.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Karen M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this camera.  Easy to use.  My only complaint is that the day after I received it the price went down by $20.00.

Reviews.Title: Quality
Reviews.Author: Tylor R Frailey
Reviews.Content: Such a great camera for the price! You would think you get what you pay for, this being in the cheaper side of cameras, u actually get a lot more then I realized with quality.Only down side, drains batteries pretty quick . Get a lot of rechargeable ones!

Reviews.Title: had it only for about a week. Works as advertized
Reviews.Author: someone
Reviews.Content: Great pictures and videos, agree with most other reviewers. Panorama mode is awesome! Not long enough to write a detailed review but it appears this is a great camera for the casual user.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Jared Hatch
Reviews.Content: Good camera. The auto modes actually work quite we'll for me. My wife had trouble with the auto-focus at first, but she's got it now.

Reviews.Title: Wife's happy
Reviews.Author: nappydrew
Reviews.Content: Wife's happy, therefore, I'm happy.I thought my iPhone took nice pic's.What do I know? I'm not a photographer

Reviews.Title: Video feature not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S Sudds
Reviews.Content: The camera itself was OK. It had a little trouble focusing but admittedly there may have been some user error. However, when I used the video feature it definitely was the camera having trouble focusing on the subjects in the video. The biggest thing though was when I would zoom in and out you could hear the zoom of the camera in the video! You can hear "fzzzzzzz" zooming in and "fzzzzzzz" zooming out. It was so stupid. I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Staley
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything and then some!  The pictures are very professional looking.  The zoom works great, too.  Absolutely love it!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: twylyte
Reviews.Content: i've had the s8200 since January and i love it. it's great for on the go shooting. it's not a high end dslr, it is a bridge camera so as long as you know what you are buying it is a great camera for the price. it does not have inter-changeable lenses, it does not have a hot shoe, it goes through tons of 'AA' batteries BUT it takes great pictures, it is light-weight, and has a lot of the options that mid-range dslr's have for a great price. if you are just starting out or you need a low price, good quality, reliable backup camera; this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Annie "country girl"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded my camera to this one, I love it, all the features it has, my favorite one is the panorama picture, the camerai is easy in handling, takes great pictures and made it my hobby, photography, even more enjoyable. I had many cameras before, also Kodak but this is the best of all of the ones I had.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LONG ZOOM POINT & SHOOT
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this 5 stars for a point & shoot.Autofocus is fast.Long zoom shots can be taken handheld.Expect some digital noise in the photos. I think this is unavoidable with today's point & shoots after trying out several over the past year. The noise is less than what is produced with the Fuji Finepix F900EXR.This camera can take nice close up portraits indoors with the flash. It will usually choose ISO 100 resulting in no noise, & the colors are true to life with detail in the picture.The flash covers a good range & produces good color in the photos. If not using flash indoors expect iso from 800 to 1600 with noise, but the photos are still usable & look nice at normal size prints.Camera uses 4 AA batteries, so we bought a nimh battery charger & 2400 mAh rechargeable batteries.This camera surprised me in that in can produce pretty blurry backgrounds with close up macro shots or full zoom in full auto mode. This is my 8 year old son's camera, & he has done it several times w/o trying.Video is great for not being a dedicated camcorder. 1080p with continual autofocus. No complaints. If you're looking at Fuji Finepix F900EXR & want video, skip it. Video is poor.

Reviews.Title: SLR quality at a fraction of the cost
Reviews.Author: Grand Wazoo
Reviews.Content: Spent quite a bit of time researching cameras before buying one, and found lots of positive comments about this one.  Reasonable price with many features.  Sure, the badge whores would never consider anything but a Canon, but feature for feature, this camera delivers almost as much for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jeramy
Reviews.Content: This camera does exactly what I want. Got it at a great price. Others like it go for around the 1000's of  dollars range. The zoom the angle the clearness, HD, it truly has it all

Reviews.Title: super camera
Reviews.Author: James H. Foster
Reviews.Content: great camera.  no problems.  easy to use; great photos.  good size for woman's hand.  no problems or cons; no complaints

Reviews.Title: Excellent prodict and price
Reviews.Author: Jitty Kitty Closet, Inc - Jitty Kitty
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the capabilities of this camera. Excellent price for the product we received.Was son's graduation gift and he loves it!

Reviews.Title: As good as one twice the price
Reviews.Author: Christopher Owens "everything samsung"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it. I took pictures of a boat 5 miles or more away from my beach balcony. Excellent camera

Reviews.Title: Not for me!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Mermaid
Reviews.Content: ... and sadly, probably not for you either--if quality, depth, clarity, and vividness are important to you. I wanted to like this camera b/c it's reasonably priced and I'd seen a couple of photos on Flickr thought made me believe it could compete with cameras like my Panny line. Not even close. It was pretty much like taking a picture with a cellphone--if that. The only good thing I can say about it is that the super macro is very amazing. I got so close to a flower that I ended up with pollen on the lens. Only problem is the resulting picture still wasn't of the quality that I would be proud to show it. Way too noisy (with or without flash); the zoom is very very noisy as well--not just when taking video but when just taking pix; shutter button takes more effort that it should to take a picture; and the battery compartment lid feels like it would break extremely easily when using the camera frequently--and sadly that's also where the SD card goes as well (I transfer my pix via the SD card plugged into my laptop--lots of transferring). .Sorry. had to send back.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, but not perfect.
Reviews.Author: S. Benda
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to the Badlands and Devils Tower to see how it does with landscapes. Controls and many features weresimilar to my Nikon Coolpix. One big plus is the zoom. Incredible smooth zoom action that gives much more control than Nikon,plus the 40x is worth the purchase. Most landscape and wildlife shots were taken either at dawn or late morning, and majority areexcellent.However, some canyon shots are very underexposed, which is surprising since the lighting was perfect. Also there was severalshots at Devils Tower where the color saturation was way off. Some of these "errors" might be my own fault, since I did not have achance to practice with the Fuji before vacation.Overall I am very satisfied, though, with the camera and hopefully with more practice can eliminate the few bugs I found.

Reviews.Title: Nice zoom
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The view finder is horrible. It's blurry and seems only good for a general framing of the picture. All other features work well

Reviews.Title: Features, Quality, and Price
Reviews.Author: John M. Graves
Reviews.Content: Shop all you want. Compare all you want. This little camera from Fujifilm is full of features that you will not find all in one camera from the major brands. The price should make Nikon, Canon, Olympus, and Pentax shutter!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT...
Reviews.Author: M. Velasquez "Curioso"
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA WORKS VERY WELL AND THE OPTICAL ZOOM (40X) IS ONE OF THE REASONS I PURCHASED IT.... THE PRICE WAS THE SECOND REASON AND THE PICTURES IT TAKES ARE VERY BEAUTIFUL.... I WOULD CERTAINLY BUY ANOTHER  "FUJIFILM" PRODUCT.....

Reviews.Title: Great Fugi product
Reviews.Author: lindsey
Reviews.Content: Haven't had a lot of time to use it, but so far it has been an excellent piece of equipment. Downloaded instructional manual which makes it easier. Great price and will accomplish an array of tasks.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for that price
Reviews.Author: Mauricio Cortes
Reviews.Content: Good overall performance and many functions for a low price.I would like Manual Focus in this camera, but it is just a bridge model.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Gwen Niccum
Reviews.Content: The only thing that would make it better is to have camera function work with rechargable system and not 4 batteries

Reviews.Title: Kick A$% Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: KillerBees
Reviews.Content: This camera has so many features and is a great price! I'm looking forward to putting it to good use!

Reviews.Title: Very nice!!
Reviews.Author: José Ramos
Reviews.Content: This is my first fuji film camera. I hope it's good brand. Is a excellent choice for quality and price. Recommended

Reviews.Title: very bad picture quality
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed about the quality of the pictures, it has a lot of noise and the colours are kind of pink. The other features of the camera seems to be OK.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is what I wanted and then some. I would buy it as a gift for my family.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: cadence crovetti
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!! I read reviews and researched for months and couldnt decide on a camera. I am so glad i got this. The zoom and shutter speed are amazing! I am not a camera pro but the pics i can take on this are excellent!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Willa Baker
Reviews.Content: Clear pictures, easy to use.  The price was great $300.  We really feel that we got our money's worth with this product

Reviews.Title: Limited Aperture Settings
Reviews.Author: B. M.
Reviews.Content: At the short end, you can only get three aperture settings in manual mode: f/2.9, 3.2, and 8.4.  That's right.  It jumps from 3.2 all the way to 8.4.  There's no way to get other settings like 3.5, 4.0, etc., unless you zoom out which is rather weird.  I called Fuji and was able to reach a helpful tech support person very quickly on the phone.  He told that's actually the way the camera was designed and that's just the way it is.  He actually agreed with me that it's odd for a camera to limit you like that.  He said the S series is meant to be a limited feature model.I ended up shipping the camera back.  It's a shame that anyone would put out a camera that does that.  And there's nothing in the specs to warn you about this.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Just received the S8200 yesterday
Reviews.Author: William W. Weikel Jr.
Reviews.Content: I'm still playing with the camera and reading the disk supplied product manual but I believe this is going to be a fantastic camera once I figure out all of it's capabilities.  After I use it a few times I'll give it an upgraded review, but for now I'm a happy happy novice photography. All the reviews seem pretty encouraging. Four stars because I really haven't used it yet.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Mikey
Reviews.Content: Missing the WOW factor! Took a lot of pictures, under a variety of settings, of many subjects, under different lighting conditions, and didn't get one image that validated my decision to buy this camera. All the gimmicks and features in the world don't make up for poor picture quality. Pictures in general were noisy, blurry, and contained digital artifacts. Used the automatic setting and took HD video. Later, when viewing the video, I could hear the auto focus click-click-clicking as it hunted for the correct focus. I suspect there's a way to avoid that but I assumed automatic meant automatic and all I had to do was point and shoot. I took some video of the same scene using my Motorola smart phone and compared them side by side. The phone video was better than the camera video.I have enjoyed the digital photo/videography hobby for many years and have owned  many digital cameras so I'm not a novice. But I wasn't able to find the sweet spot with the S8200 and didn't feel it should have been necessary to search for it.One last item . .  there is NO manual focus on this camera, a critical requirement for taking long focus images.

Reviews.Title: Did not meet expectations
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Bought the Fuji as a smaller version of a "regular" digital SLR that we had been using for years. Picture quality of the Fuji was poor in comparison to the Sony SLR.  Returned the Fuji as it just didn't seem to be doing a good job with the pictures taken. Perhaps more time spent with it would have improved the results, but didn't want to get stuck with a camera we didn't like.

Reviews.Title: Nice more than I expected!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: SYLVIA HERNANDEZ
Reviews.Content: Great camera with some great features more than I expected. Still haven't used it I'm waiting to use on my the cruise trip

Reviews.Title: Batteries?
Reviews.Author: Frank J. DeFelice
Reviews.Content: This camera uses batteries (AA) which is not mentioned in the description. No rechargeable lithium battery.  Also, the rangefinder doesn't seem to work. You have to use the monitor.

Reviews.Title: Colors goofy
Reviews.Author: gary masterson
Reviews.Content: So I go out to shoot birds...Nikon and this camera.  Fuji colors about 60% as good.  They look washed out and do not blow up to poster size even tho there are more pixels than a Nikon 5100.  Also, my prime shipping took a week..

Reviews.Title: Wished it would have worked
Reviews.Author: Ann Blevins
Reviews.Content: My family got this camera for me for my birthday and it only worked long enough to take 1 picture. :-( . It took several weeks to get my refund.

Reviews.Title: it was awful
Reviews.Author: Debra A. Spillane
Reviews.Content: i don't like it the quality sucks, it doesn't take the pictures fast enough and it doesn't focus very well either.

Reviews.Title: It stopped working
Reviews.Author: Dayana Zapata
Reviews.Content: I feel very frustrated. The camera stopped working after two days. I did not have the chance to enjoy the camera even one time. Bad quality. I did not have the time to return it because I live outside USA and I left after I bought it. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: Beware People!
Reviews.Author: Milanprima
Reviews.Content: These numerous reviews are for several different cameras, not just the one you are trying to research.  I made the mistake of choosing one based on what I read in reviews and it turned out NOT to have a viewfinder after all. So now I have to send it back.  I think Amazon should not mix reviews for different cameras this way.  It is really deceptive advertising.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: robert
Reviews.Content: The item description made it sound like a manual focus camera, but it's anything but that. It looks much higher quality than it really is, as it's just a blob of plastic. I should of realized this ofr the price. =D

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Bonita S. Gilbert "yankeerev"
Reviews.Content: I have no idea if this camera is any good because I can't use it.  My husband gave me this camera for Christmas.  The card said "open me first" so I could take family pictures with it.  This is the sixth digital camera we have bought, and it's the first one ever  that didn't come with a memory card.  So, no pictures.  There is nothing on the Amazon web site or on the box it came in that said anything about the memory card being a separate purchase. When I called tech support the woman was quite snotty about it.  I am feeling ripped off and NOT happy.

Reviews.Title: big point n shoot with tiny sensor and noise
Reviews.Author: kay bhee
Reviews.Content: VERY typical camera nowadaysi did NOT buy it, due to not sharp enuff, andtoo much noise even at iso 200not enuff for me... need more sharpness, atmax zoom...i want to SEE and read those signs mama....not blur them out of memoryhalf the people will be accepting of this cameraby Default..asthere are many many more worse cameras in our world todayjust lying around like reincarnated dirty mouse traps.so, if compared, this is stillsemi ok for most average people...its a point and shoot and its big... tiny sensor,noise, and the usual  usd 150 camera problems persist.duhh

ProductInfo.Features:
16 million pixels
1/ 2.3-inch CMOS with primary color filter
3.0-inch, approx. 460K-dots, TFT color LCD monitor
Fujinon 46 x optical zoom lens
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix 16.2MP Digital Camera with 42x Optical Zoom (S8500)
